title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 346.2 - Report of attending chiropractor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 346.2 - Report of attending chiropractor

State Regulations

The attending chiropractor shall obtain a complete history
from the claimant of his injury or disease and shall report this to the
chairman, together with a full report of the known injury or condition as
determined by his examination, as well as of any other injury or condition. "Known" injury or condition includes any condition the existence of which is
ascertainable through chiropractic analysis. "Reported" injury or disease
includes any condition the existence of which is ascertainable either visually
or from an authoritative source, such as the claimant, employer, a physician, etc. The report of injury or condition so ascertained shall not be deemed to
constitute a professional opinion. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
346.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
